name: Federal Shooting Festival at Basel
obverse: A soldier holding on to his battle flag and broken sword as he collapses onto his shield.
obverse_inscriptions: ST. IACOB AN DER BORS 26 AUGUST 1444.
reverse: Nine coat of arms circles surround an inscription in 9 lines.
reverse_inscriptions: DER SCHILD ZERBROCHEN. DAS SCHWERT ENTZWEI. DAS BANNER IN STERBENDER HAND. TRIUMPH DAS VATERLAND BLEIBT FREI. GOTT SEGNE DAS VATERLAND.
description: This medal was made in 1844 for the Federal Shooting Festival at Basel.
It also celebrated the 400th Anniversary of the Battle of St. Jacob an der Birs.
